abstract: Both Google and Facebook are primed to introduce new online music services in the week ahead.
snippet: Both Google and Facebook are primed to introduce new online music services in the week ahead.
lead_paragraph: Several reports Wednesday indicate that Google is set to roll-out a music service at an event at the iconic Capitol Records building in Hollywood next Wednesday. The service, we’ve confirmed from three people briefed on the details, will offer searchers a better way to find and sample music on Google – much in the same way people can get detailed financial information about a company from Google Finance.

headline.main: Hot on Heels of Google, Facebook to Take First Step Into Music

abstract: Report from Bits on new music services from major Web sites.
snippet: Report from Bits on new music services from major Web sites.
lead_paragraph: Our good friends at the Bits blog (the Bitsers?) have the lowdown on the new music services from Google and Facebook. They report:

headline.main: Google and Facebook Get Into the Music Game

abstract: Gmail warns if you have accidentally included a contact with a similar name — instead of the name of the person you usually include in a regular list of e-mail recipients.
snippet: Gmail warns if you have accidentally included a contact with a similar name — instead of the name of the person you usually include in a regular list of e-mail recipients.
lead_paragraph: Like earlier add-ons cooked up by Gmail Labs, a new optional feature for Google’s Web mail service can help save you from yourself. With the experimental “Got the Wrong Bob?” feature turned on, Gmail warns if you have accidentally included a contact with a similar name  instead of the name of the person you usually include in a regular list of e-mail recipients. To activate the feature, log into your Gmail account on the Web, click the green beaker icon to go to the Labs options and click the button to enable “Got the Wrong Bob?” (You can also get there by clicking the Settings link on your Gmail account page and then clicking on the Labs tab.) Click the Save Changes button when finished. A post on the Gmail blog (bit.ly/3VZPIV) has details.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: “Got the Wrong Bob?”

abstract: Google’s service will allow users to sample music after they search for information. Facebook is adding songs through its gift shop.
snippet: Google’s service will allow users to sample music after they search for information. Facebook is adding songs through its gift shop.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Music fans are about to get two new ways to find and sample songs on the Web, as Google and Facebook introduce new features on their services.

headline.main: Facebook and Google Expected to Offer Music
headline.print_headline: More Music Is Expected At Facebook And Google

abstract: The deals to make Twitter streams available to Microsoft and Google’s search engines may point to a potential new source of cash.
snippet: The deals to make Twitter streams available to Microsoft and Google’s search engines may point to a potential new source of cash.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Twitter gets 55 million monthly visitors, it has raised $155 million in venture capital, and it has generated intense interest from Hollywood to Iran. But it hasn’t earned much revenue and certainly no profit.

headline.main: 2 Deals Hint at Revenue for Twitter
headline.print_headline: 2 Deals Hint At Revenue For Twitter

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Claire Cain Miller
